details.title: Smriti Irani tweets on Yoga Day
details.content:
Yoga not only contributes to our fitness and well-being but also opens doors to self-discovery and spirituality. On #4thYogaDay, let us cherish our timeless heritage and adopt Yoga for a healthy lifestyle. #InternationalYogaDay2018 pic.twitter.com/IYadai4dcN

— Smriti Z Irani (@smritiirani) June 21, 2018
Former PM HD Devegowda performing Yoga at his residence in Bengaluru on Thursday. (Express Photo by Nagaraja Gadekal)
Yoga being performed at a session organised by The New Indian Express and Dinamani at Gill Nagar Park, Choolaimedu, in Chennai on Thursday. (Express Photo by P Jawahar)
Yoga being performed at a session organised by The New Indian Express and Dinamani at Gill Nagar Park, Choolaimedu, in Chennai on Thursday. (Express Photo by P Jawahar)

#InternationalYogaDay2018: Union Minister Piyush Goyal & BJP MLA Pankaj Singh perform Yoga in Noida. pic.twitter.com/oqp5tXzHo8

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) June 21, 2018

details.title: PM Modi on Yoga Day
details.content:
I want it to become a people's movement because it is not something political or religious, it is for betterment of our lives. It shouldn't be just for one day, it should be a part of our daily lives: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu in Mumbai on #InternationalYogaDay2018. pic.twitter.com/FUfuaFfvyF

— ANI (@ANI) June 21, 2018

details.title: UNESCO on Yoga Day
details.content:
#Yoga is an art of living, a way of being, it is about finding one's true Self & connecting with it. On 21 June, join #YogaDay celebrations pic.twitter.com/saEzTvEW8P

— UNESCO (@UNESCO) June 21, 2018
People performing yoga at a session organised by The New Indian Express and Dinamani on Thursday at Choolaimedu's Gill Nagar Park, Chennai (Express Photo by P Jawahar)

details.title: WATCH | Bengaluru celebrates Yoga Day

details.content:
#UttarPradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Governor Ram Naik & Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh performed Yoga in Lucknow during early morning hours. #InternationalYogaDay2018 pic.twitter.com/DkBhd8bNO9

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) June 21, 2018

Yoga was performed in Cambodia's Phnom Penh in the early morning hours #InternationalYogaDay2018 pic.twitter.com/4t4jkz8KK1

— ANI (@ANI) June 21, 2018

#Mumbai Union Minister Prakash Javadekar performs Yoga at Marine Drive on #InternationalYogaDay2018 pic.twitter.com/GrrYj7BNvZ

— ANI (@ANI) June 21, 2018

Yoga being performed at the US Embassy in Delhi on #InternationalYogaDay2018. pic.twitter.com/YM42gKUtmp

— ANI (@ANI) June 21, 2018

Rajnath Singh who is performing yoga at Lucknow credited PM Modi for the international recognition accorded to yoga. "While yoga has been there for ages, it got its rightful place on the global platform due to the efforts of our Prime Minister and now people take it seriously and have reaped its health benefits," he added. (IANS)

Rajnath Singh cleared doubts that yoga was meant only for Hindus and pointed had that been the case, it would not have been supported by 177 countries across the world, which included the world body UN and 46 Islamic nations. (IANS)

Assam: Saints at Guwahati's Kamakhya temple perform Yoga #InternationalYogaDay2018 pic.twitter.com/Om0k4OK8Pa

— ANI (@ANI) June 21, 2018

details.title: Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi reacts to reports of JD(U) not taking part in Yoga Day
details.content:
It is not a question about JDU. I know more than dozen people present here who are from JDU. Don't people from RJD & JDU practice Yoga? It is not necessary that everyone comes out to participate: Bihar Dy CM Sushil Modi on reports of JDU not participating in Yoga day celebration pic.twitter.com/QSqYIQugqr

— ANI (@ANI) June 21, 2018

details.title: Sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik creates sand art for Yoga Day
details.content:
My SandArt on #InternationalYogaDay2018 with message "yoga for harmony and peace” at Puri beach, Odisha. I’ve shown world's top leaders like US President, Chinese President, Russian President, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and Hon PM @narendramodi with their country flags. pic.twitter.com/NHDBCP0zVH

— Sudarsan Pattnaik (@sudarsansand) June 21, 2018
